p: The essential oils from both O. citriodorum and O. thyrsiflora varieties of basil show high inhibition rates against S. aureus bacteria, which makes it possible to consider using these oils as active natural ingredients for the treatment of skin irritations, since S. aureus is extremeley common on the skin of patients with certain dermatological diseases [20], and it is often considered to be a major culprit in causing skin irritation and soft tissue infections [21]. At the same time, the combination of very strong antioxidant properties with some tyrosinase inhibition abilities makes the essential oil of O. thyrsiflora a good candidate to be used as a multifunctional cosmetic active in various cosmetic formulas, namely as an antioxidant with some additional skin brightening properties.
